verses.text: 耶和華必保護耶路撒冷以下是耶和華的默示，這是耶和華論到以色列的話（是耶和華的宣告，他鋪張諸天，奠定大地的根基，造成人裡面的靈）：

words.note: Refers to what is stated afterward.
Lit. 'silent revelation'.
A more classical/biblical term for 'heavens'.

verses.text: 「看哪！我要使耶路撒冷成為令周圍萬族喝醉的杯；耶路撒冷被圍困的時候，猶大也必受到攻擊。

words.note: Commonly used in biblical contexts for 'all Gentiles' or 'all peoples'.

verses.text: 到那日，我要使耶路撒冷對萬族來說像一塊沉重的石頭，舉起它的必受重傷；地上的列國必聚集起來攻擊耶路撒冷。

words.note: Commonly used in biblical contexts for 'all Gentiles' or 'all peoples'.
Often used in the fixed phrase '對...來說' (as far as... is concerned).
Here nominalizes the preceding clause: 'those who lift it'.
Indicates completion, beginning, or intensifying of an action.

verses.text: 到那日（這是耶和華的宣告），我要擊打所有的馬匹，使牠們驚恐，擊打騎馬的人，使他們瘋狂；我必開眼看顧猶大家，我要擊打萬族所有的馬匹，使牠們瞎眼。

words.note: Refers to the household or people of Judah.
Commonly used in biblical contexts for 'all Gentiles' or 'all peoples'.

verses.text: 那時，猶大的族長必心裡說：『耶路撒冷的居民，靠萬軍之耶和華他們的 神得著力量。』

words.definition: LORD of hosts, LORD of Armies

verses.text: 「到那日，我必使猶大的族長好像木柴中的火盆，又好像禾捆中的火把；他們必向左右吞滅周圍的萬族，但耶路撒冷的人必仍在城中原處安居。

words.note: Common phrase in prophetic literature.
Indicates strong certainty or necessity.
Indicates strong certainty or necessity.
Common biblical term for 'all peoples/ethnicities'.
Indicates strong certainty or necessity.

verses.text: 「耶和華必先拯救猶大的帳棚，免得大衛家的榮耀和耶路撒冷居民的榮耀勝過猶大。

words.note: The personal name of God in the Old Testament.
Indicates strong certainty or necessity.
Often used in a spiritual or religious context.
Refers to dwellings, often symbolic of a people or family line.
Refers to the lineage or descendants of King David.
Often refers to divine glory or high honor.
Often refers to divine glory or high honor.

verses.text: 到那日，耶和華必保護耶路撒冷的居民；他們中間最軟弱的，到那日必好像大衛，大衛家必好像 神，好像行在他們前面的耶和華使者。

words.note: Common phrase in prophetic literature.
The personal name of God in the Old Testament.
Indicates strong certainty or necessity.
Common phrase in prophetic literature.
Indicates strong certainty or necessity.
Refers to the lineage or descendants of King David.
Indicates strong certainty or necessity.
Refers to the supreme deity.
The personal name of God in the Old Testament.
Can refer to a human messenger or a divine angel.

verses.text: 到那日，我必殲滅所有前來攻打耶路撒冷的列國。

words.note: Common phrase in prophetic literature.
Indicates strong certainty or necessity.
Often used in military or destructive contexts.
Common biblical term for 'the nations'.

verses.text: 大哀哭「我必把那恩慈與懇求的靈傾注在大衛家和耶路撒冷居民的身上。他們必仰望我，就是他們所刺的；他們要為他哀哭，好像喪獨生子；他們必為他悲痛，好像喪長子。

words.note: Often used in a religious or deep mourning context.
Indicates strong certainty or necessity.
Often refers to divine grace and mercy.
Can refer to the human spirit, a spirit being, or the Holy Spirit.
Refers to the lineage or descendants of King David.
Indicates strong certainty or necessity.
Often implies looking to God for help or hope.
Forms a nominal phrase referring to the object of the following verb.
Often used in a religious or deep mourning context.
Often used with deep emotional or theological significance.
Indicates strong certainty or necessity.
Refers to the eldest son, who often held a special position.

verses.text: 到那日，耶路撒冷必有極大的哀哭，像在米吉多平原的哈達臨門的哀哭一樣。

words.note: Often used in time expressions like '那日' (that day).
Refers to deep mourning and weeping.
A place associated with profound mourning in Israelite history.
Refers to deep mourning and weeping.

verses.text: 全地都要哀哭，一家一家獨在一處哀哭。大衛家獨在一處，他們的婦女也獨在一處；拿單家獨在一處，他們的婦女也獨在一處；

words.note: Reduplication emphasizes 'each and every'.

verses.text: 利未家獨在一處，他們的婦女也獨在一處；示每家獨在一處，他們的婦女也獨在一處；
其餘的各家都是一家一家獨在一處，他們的婦女也獨在一處。」

words.note: Reduplication emphasizes 'each and every'.
